intro: Barclaya kunstleri, commonly known as the narrowleaf barclaya, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces showy, yellow flowers with five petals, often arranged in clusters. Barclaya kunstleri thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for xeriscaping in arid regions.
